perturbation.original_text: 4. Duration and Termination. The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall end on the 60th day following a written notice from one party to the other of its decision to terminate this Agreement at the end of such 60-day period or upon termination of the applicable Distribution Agreement with respect to a Fund. Termination of this Agreement as to a Fund shall not terminate this Agreement with respect to any other Fund so long as such other Fund’s (or Funds’, as the case may be) Distribution Agreement is effective. If this Agreement is terminated by one party, it shall terminate the entire Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. Duration and Termination. The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall end on the 60th day following a written notice from one party to the other of its decision to terminate this Agreement at the end of such 60-day period or upon termination of the applicable Distribution Agreement with respect to a Fund. Termination of this Agreement as to a Fund shall not terminate this Agreement with respect to any other Fund so long as such other Fund’s (or Funds’, as the case may be) Distribution Agreement is effective. If this Agreement is terminated by one party regarding one fund, it will only terminate regarding that fund.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that if one party terminates the agreement, it terminates the *entire* agreement. The modified text says that if one party terminates the agreement regarding one fund, it only terminates with respect to that particular fund. This creates a contradiction regarding the scope of termination.

perturbation.original_text: 9. Fund Materials. S2K shall be entitled to produce materials (“Fund Materials”) for use in marketing a Fund as described herein, so long as the Fund Materials are produced, reviewed, principally approved, used and filed, where necessary, in accordance with FINRA and SEC regulations and those of any jurisdiction in which a Fund is solicited through use of the Fund Materials. All expenses and costs attributable to the foregoing provision shall be borne by S2K in accordance with Section 2 and Section 5 herein. S2K shall remain liable for any representations made by it or contained in materials produced and approved by S2K for use in marketing the Funds.
perturbation.changed_text: 9. Fund Materials. S2K shall be entitled to produce materials (“Fund Materials”) for use in marketing a Fund as described herein, so long as the Fund Materials are produced, reviewed, principally approved, used and filed, where necessary, in accordance with FINRA and SEC regulations and those of any jurisdiction in which a Fund is solicited through use of the Fund Materials. All expenses and costs attributable to the foregoing provision shall be borne by the Distributor in accordance with Section 2 and Section 5 herein. S2K shall not be liable for any representations made by it or contained in materials produced and approved by S2K for use in marketing the Funds.
perturbation.explanation: The original text said that S2K bears the costs and expenses for Fund Materials and remains liable for any representations. The modified text now shifts the costs to the Distributor and removes S2K's liability for representations in the fund materials, contradicting the original allocation of responsibilities.

perturbation.original_text: 12. Use of Names; Marketing Materials. Each party to this Agreement shall obtain the other party’s prior written consent before using any marketing or sales literature related to the consenting party, and shall not use the other party’s names in any marketing or advertising materials without prior written consent from the consenting party.
perturbation.changed_text: 12. Use of Names; Marketing Materials. Each party to this Agreement shall obtain the other party’s prior written consent before using any marketing or sales literature related to the consenting party, but can use the other party’s names in any marketing or advertising materials without prior written consent from the consenting party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text required prior written consent before using the other party's names in marketing materials. The modified text now allows use of the other party's name *without* prior written consent, directly contradicting the first half of the sentence.
